activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#12093
activity.text:
> @abhimanyurajeesh @AdityaJ2305 when i am clicking on setting button tooltip become invisible but when i am clicking on children it again coming up i tasted while fixing it the problem is i am trying to fix this also but the problem is after clicking on SubButton the click function is not working i emplemented this logic also but that error doesn't got fix function SidebarMenuSubItem({ <Tooltip open={state === "collapsed"} onOpenChange={setIsTooltipOpen}> <Comp data-sidebar="menu-sub-button" data-size={size} data-active={isActive} className={cn( "flex h-7 w-full min-w-0 -translate-x-px items-center gap-2 overflow-hidden rounded-md px-2 text-sidebar-foreground outline-hidden ring-sidebar-ring hover:bg-sidebar-accent hover:text-sidebar-accent-foreground focus-visible:ring-2 active:bg-sidebar-accent active:text-sidebar-accent-foreground disabled:pointer-events-none disabled:opacity-50 aria-disabled:pointer-events-none aria-disabled:opacity-50 [&>span:last-child]:truncate [&>svg]:size-4 [&>svg]:shrink-0 [&>svg]:text-sidebar-accent-foreground", "data-[active=true]:bg-sidebar-accent data-[active=true]:text-sidebar-accent-foreground", size === "sm" && "text-xs", size === "md" && "text-sm", "group-data-[collapsible=icon]:hidden", className, )} onClick={handleClick} onMouseEnter={() => setIsTooltipOpen(true)} onMouseLeave={() => setIsTooltipOpen(false)} {...props} > {children} <TooltipContent side="right" align="center" {...(typeof children === "string" ? { children } : {})} /> can you please guide me how to solve this


Hey @maishivamhoo123, I have solved the issue in https://github.com/ohcnetwork/care_fe/pull/12187.

As you know the issue was the tooltip would flash briefly after closing the popover. This happened because tooltips open on focus, and when the popover closed, focus automatically returned to the trigger, causing the tooltip to reappear. To fix this, I added onCloseAutoFocus={(e) => e.preventDefault()} to the PopoverContent. This prevents focus from returning to the trigger after the popover closes, which stops the tooltip from being triggered again.

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#10972
activity.text:
> @abhimanyurajeesh I've reviewed your PR implementing Two-Factor Authentication (2FA) support. Here's my assessment:
> ## Strengths
> 
>     * **Complete Implementation**: You've created a comprehensive 2FA solution with TOTP support, backup codes, and proper user flows.
> 
>     * **Security**: Your implementation follows security best practices with temporary tokens and proper authentication flows.
> 
>     * **User Experience**: The UI includes clear instructions, error states, and recovery options.
> 
>     * **Internationalization**: All strings are properly localized in the en.json file.
> 
>     * **Integration**: The changes seamlessly integrate with the existing authentication system.
> 
> 
> ## Implementation Details
> 
>     * The authentication flow correctly handles both standard and MFA responses
> 
>     * Type guards ensure proper type safety for different response types
> 
>     * Backup code generation and management is properly implemented
> 
>     * The new `/authenticate` route handles the MFA verification step
> 
>     * User profile pages appropriately show 2FA options only for the user's own profile
> 
> 
> Overall, this is a well-architected implementation that follows the codebase's existing patterns and provides a robust 2FA solution.
> ✅ Actions performed

what about a code review

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#10821
activity.text:
> Great 👍
> 
>  1. Root doesn't allow expansion/collapse..is that intended? 🤔  If so, we should disable the button and hide the chevron.
> 
> 2. Since we are allowing users to move the nodes around, expand/collapse should preserve their current position, no? Instead it resets it 🤔
> 
> 
> Well, not a big deal per say, depends on what we want product side.


1. Yeah, the root doesn’t allow expansion/collapse, so I’ll hide the chevron.
2. Good point it depends on what we want from the product side. If needed, we could add a button to reset the node, though it’s not mandatory.

I guess for now, I’ll quickly hide the chevron for the root.

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#10821
activity.text:
> > > > The behavior on expanding a node isn't ideal 🤔 Right now, it zooms out and focuses on the entire tree; it would be better if it focuses on the node that is being expanded (zooming in if needed).
> > > 
> > > 
> > > Just focus on the node that is being expanded or did you mean the child nodes of the parent?
> > 
> > 
> > @Jacobjeevan did you mean like this?
> > Screen.Recording.2025-03-04.at.9.01.33.AM.mov
> 
> Somewhat 🤔 On expansion, it still zooms out for a second there (0:08 onwards..instead of just zooming in directly to focus on the node that's expanded).
> 
> On collapse, focus on node's (that's being collapsed) parent.

Oh ya got it.
